page.title: 10Glass making in Buriton
page.content: Glass making was made in the beech woods near Buriton, on the Ditcham House Estate during Tudor times. Beech wood being best suited for the purpose. At the south end of Glass Brow by the side of an old track, which is not a public footpath, is all that remains of a glass works site. There is a sealed well on the edge of the site and the remains of kilns. This site was discovered in 1970 by the Rev P Gallup, the rector of Buriton. Now little is visible where forestry has taken over. Some of the funds are deposited in Portsmouth City Museum (accesssion No 1971/202). Re this site see "William Overotn & Glassmaking" by R Fox & E Lewis. Published by Petersfield Area Historical Society. Monograph number 1.
